articles.headline: Posing as a Family, Sex Offenders Stun a Town
articles.snippet: A 29-year-old who had enrolled as a 12-year-old at an Arizona middle school is part of a web of child predators.
articles.abstract: A 29-year-old who had enrolled as a 12-year-old at an Arizona middle school is part of a web of child predators.
articles.lead_paragraph: EL MIRAGE, Ariz., Jan. 31 — To neighbors, Casey Price was a seventh grader with acne and a baseball cap who lived an unremarkable life among a bevy of male relatives.

articles.headline: Chirac Strays From Assailing a Nuclear Iran
articles.snippet: France’s president said that if Iran had one or two nuclear weapons, it would not pose a big danger. A day later, he retracted many of his remarks.
articles.abstract: France’s president said that if Iran had one or two nuclear weapons, it would not pose a big danger. A day later, he retracted many of his remarks.
articles.lead_paragraph: PARIS, Jan. 31 — President Jacques Chirac said this week that if Iran had one or two nuclear weapons, it would not pose a big danger, and that if Iran were to launch a nuclear weapon against a country like Israel, it would lead to the immediate destruction of Tehran.
articles.byline: By Elaine Sciolino and Katrin Bennhold

articles.headline: Overseas Calls Made Cheap, if Not Easy
articles.snippet: The latest options in portable Internet phone-calling equipment that might appeal to the inner economist in you.
articles.abstract: The latest options in portable Internet phone-calling equipment that might appeal to the inner economist in you.
articles.lead_paragraph: You want to know how much it costs to make a 10-minute call to New York from London? From a pay phone, $15.70. From a T-Mobile or Cingular cellphone (American handsets that work overseas), $3.40 to $12.90. From your hotel room phone, $58. Perhaps it would be cheaper just to fly home.

articles.headline: Biden Unwraps ’08 Bid With an Oops!
articles.snippet: In an era of meticulous political choreography, the kickoff for Senator Joseph R. Biden Jr.’s presidential candidacy could hardly have gone worse.
articles.abstract: In an era of meticulous political choreography, the kickoff for Senator Joseph R. Biden Jr.’s presidential candidacy could hardly have gone worse.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Jan. 31 — In an era of meticulous political choreography, the staging of the kickoff for this presidential candidacy could hardly have gone worse.

articles.headline: An Island of Moguls Is Latest Front in Union Battle
articles.snippet: A labor union has set its sights on Fisher Island, Fla., one of the most concentrated pockets of wealth in the nation.
articles.abstract: A labor union has set its sights on Fisher Island, Fla., one of the most concentrated pockets of wealth in the nation.
articles.lead_paragraph: FISHER ISLAND, Fla., Jan 26 — The class struggle is coming to paradise.

articles.headline: US Airways Withdraws Its $10.2 Billion Offer for Delta
articles.snippet: The withdrawal ends speculation of an imminent wave of consolidation in the troubled airline industry.
articles.abstract: The withdrawal ends speculation of an imminent wave of consolidation in the troubled airline industry.
articles.lead_paragraph: Someday, the long-predicted wave of consolidation in the airline industry could occur.
articles.byline: By Micheline Maynard and Michael J. de la Merced

articles.headline: What Could Bog Down the Bull
articles.snippet: Markets celebrated the Fed’s action but analysts warned that the road ahead promises to be a long, hard slog as corporate profits are starting to slow.
articles.abstract: Markets celebrated the Fed’s action but analysts warned that the road ahead promises to be a long, hard slog as corporate profits are starting to slow.
articles.lead_paragraph: Stocks surged yesterday afternoon, sending the Dow Jones industrial average to within a hair of a new high, after the Federal Reserve pointed to strength in the economy and a moderation in inflation.

articles.headline: Dell Chief Is Replaced by Founder
articles.snippet: Michael S. Dell has taken back the leadership of the computer company he founded, replacing Kevin B. Rollins.
articles.abstract: Michael S. Dell has taken back the leadership of the computer company he founded, replacing Kevin B. Rollins.
articles.lead_paragraph: Michael S. Dell has taken back the leadership of the computer company he founded, replacing Kevin B. Rollins after more than a year of mounting problems at Dell.

articles.headline: German Court Challenges C.I.A. Over Abduction
articles.snippet: An arrest warrant was issued for 13 people in a case of mistaken arrest that highlights the agency’s policy of secret transfers of terrorism suspects.
articles.abstract: An arrest warrant was issued for 13 people in a case of mistaken arrest that highlights the agency’s policy of secret transfers of terrorism suspects.
articles.lead_paragraph: FRANKFURT, Jan. 31 — A German court on Wednesday issued an arrest warrant for 13 people in the mistaken kidnapping and jailing of a German citizen of Lebanese descent, in the most serious legal challenge yet to the Central Intelligence Agency’s secret transfers of terrorism suspects.
